He served a Member of board of Commissioner at Virginia Port Authority until July 2010. Mr. Barrington has an undergraduate degree in history and political science and was awarded his law degree by Albany Law School.

column3: Executive Chairman, Chief Executive Officer and Chairman of Executive Committee,
column10: Ms. Patricia A. Woertz, also known as Pat, has been the Chief Executive Officer at Archer Daniels Midland Company since May 1, 2006. Ms. Woertz serves as the Chief Executive Officer at ADM Alliance Nutrition, Inc. She served as the President of Archer Daniels Midland Company since May 1, 2006. She focuses on extending the Archer-Daniels-Midland's strong financial momentum and accelerating the growth of its BioEnergy business while expanding its premier position in the ... agricultural processing value chain. She has a diverse background and breadth of experience. She joined Archer-Daniels-Midland Co. in April 2006. She worked at oil company, Chevron Corp., where she spent 29 years and served as its Executive Vice President of Global Downstream in charge of operations that included refining, marketing, lubricant, supply and trading businesses in 180 countries since 2001. She served as President of Chevron Products Co., its U.S. refining and fuels marketing company. She served as Vice President at Chevron Corp. since 1998. She joined Ernst & Young in Pittsburgh as a Certified Public Accountant. In 1977, She joined Gulf Oil Corp. in Pittsburgh and served positions in refining and marketing, strategic planning, and finance. In 1981, She transferred to Houston to Head a U.S. upstream audit group. From 1985 to 1987, during the merger of Gulf and Chevron, she worked on asset divestitures as part of the debt-reduction process. Since 1989, she served as Finance Manager of Chevron Information Technology Co. Since 1991, She served as Chevron Corp.'s Strategic Planning Manager and was responsible for evaluating strategies for both its planning committee and its management committee, both of which she served as Secretary. She served as the President of Chevron Canada Ltd. (CCL) since October 1993, a wholly owned subsidiary of Chevron Corp. Since January 1996, she served as President of Chevron International Oil Company, a subsidiary of Chevron Corp. and Vice President of logistics and trading for Chevron Products Co. and was responsible for supply and distribution and worldwide trading. She is an internationally recognized business leader, working frequently with government officials, heads of state, business partners and community stakeholders across the globe. She has been the Executive Chairperson at Archer Daniels Midland Company since February 2007 and its Executive Director since May 1, 2006. She has been Director at Procter & Gamble Co., since January 8, 2008. In 2000, Fortune magazine named Ms. Woertz one of the top ten most powerful women in business. In 2005, she was named a Distinguished Alumna by Pennsylvania State University. column10: Mr. Timothy M. Ring, also known as Tim, has been the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer at CR Bard Inc. since August 8, 2003. In 1999, Mr. Ring was named Group President at Bard Electrophysiology and Peripheral Vascular Products and in 2002 was given additional responsibility for Bard Access Systems, Bard Europe, and Corporate Healthcare Services. Mr. Ring served as a Group President at CR Bard Inc. from April 1997 to August 2003 with most recent oversight for Bard's ... Corporate Healthcare, Peripheral Vascular, Access Systems, and Electrophysiology Divisions as well as for all Bard's businesses in Europe, the Middle East, and Africa until August 2003. He joined CR Bard Inc. in 1992 as a Corporate Vice President of Human Resources. In November 1995, Mr. Ring was given additional responsibility for Interventional Cardiology and Electrophysiology. In January 1997, he also resumed additional responsibility for the Cardiac Assist and Cardiopulmonary divisions and in April 1997 was promoted to Group President at Coronary Vascular Products. Prior to this, Mr. Ring was employed at Abbott Laboratories for nearly 10 years, last as the Director of Personnel for the Hospital Products Division. During 1990, he was General Manager at Abbott in the Australian, New Zealand and Indonesian operations. From 1987 to 1989, he was a Director of Personnel for Pacific, Asia, Africa, and Europe. In 1984 to 1986, Mr. Ring served as Director of Personnel for Latin America and South East Asia. Mr. Ring was an Assistant Personnel Manager for the Pharmaceutical Division at Abbott, when he joined in 1983. He was employed at The General Motors Corporation, which he joined after graduation. He serves as the Chairman of the Board at Health Care Institute of New Jersey. He is a Member of the Advisory Board of Ferrer Freeman & Company, LLC. column3: Chief Executive Officer, President and Director,
column10: Mr. Hubert Joly has been the Chief Executive Officer and President of Best Buy Co., Inc. since September 2012. Mr. Joly served as the President of Carlson Hotels Worldwide and Chief Executive Officer of Carlson Hotels Worldwide for RADLAX Gateway Hotel, LLC. Mr. Joly served as the Chief Executive Officer and President of CW Government Travel, Inc. since 2008. He served as the Chief Executive Officer and President of Carlson Hotels Worldwide Inc. from March 1, 2008 to ... September 2012. Mr. Joly served as the Chief Executive Officer and President of Carlson Companies Inc., and Carlson Rezidor Hotel Group from March 1, 2008 to August 2012. Mr. Joly served as the Chief Executive Officer and President of P. Lawson Travel since July 2004. He founded Carlson Companies (formerly, Gold Bond Stamp Company) in 1938. He served as the Chief Executive Officer and President of Carlson Wagonlit B.V from July 2004 to April 2008. He was a consultant and then a partner of McKinsey & Company from 1982 to 1996. As a partner, he was specialized in the high-tech sector. Mr. Joly served as an Executive Vice President of Monitoring of US Assets of Vivendi Universal from August 2002 to June 30, 2004. He served as the Deputy Chief Financial Officer of Vivendi Universal (alternate name Vivendi) since April 2003. Mr. Joly served as a Member of the Executive Team of Vivendi Universal. Mr. Joly served as an Executive Vice President and Group Chief Information Officer of Vivendi Universal from November 2001 to November 2002. From December 2000 to October 2001, Mr. Joly was responsible for the integration of Vivendi Universal's North American activities. From July 1999 to June 2001, Mr. Joly served as the Chief Executive Officer of Havas Interactive, (known today as Vivendi Universal Games), Vivendi Universal's interactive entertainment and educational software publishing division. Mr. Joly worked in the technology sector from 1996 to 1999 as Vice President of Electronic Data Systems (EDS) Europe and president of EDS France. He served as the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of EDS France. He served as the Chief Executive Officer and President of Carlson Wagonlit Travel Canada from 2004 to 2008. He spent 12 years at McKinsey & Company Inc. Mr. Joly has global responsibility for CWT business around the world. He has vast experience and expertise in hospitality and customer service. Mr. Joly served as the Chairman of The Rezidor Hotel Group from April 2011 to September 13, 2012. He served as the Chairman of the Board of North America of Carlson Wagonlit Travel Canada since January 2009 until August 17, 2012. He served as Vice Chairman of The Rezidor Hotel Group since 2008 until April 2011. He has been a Director of Ralph Lauren Corp. since June 30, 2009. He has been a Director of Best Buy Co. Inc. since September 2012. He serves on the Boards of the Minneapolis Institute of Arts, the Minnesota Business Partnership, World Travel and Tourism Council and the American Chamber of Commerce in France. He serves as a member of the supervisory board of the Aspen Institute France. He has been a Director of Ralph Lauren Corporation since June 30, 2009. He served as a Director of The Rezidor Hotel Group from 2008 to September 13, 2012 and Carlson Hotels Worldwide, Inc. since March 2008. He served as a Director of Carlson Companies Inc. of Park Inn Houston North Hotel & Conference Center since March 1, 2008. Mr. Joly was honored as one of the 25 Most Influential Executives of the Business Travel Industry in 2006 by Business Travel News magazine. He was also elected a Global Leader for Tomorrow by the World Economic Forum Davos, from 1997 to 1999, and chosen as a young executive of the year by L'Expansion magazine in 1996 and IT CEO of the Year in France in 1998. He recently became a member of the U.S. Department of Commerce Travel and Tourism Advisory Board. He also is a member of the executive committee of the World Travel and Tourism Council, serves on the board of trustees of the Minneapolis Institute of Arts, and is a member of the executive committee of the Minnesota Business Partnership. column3: Chief Executive Officer and Director,
column10: Dr. George A. Scangos, Ph.D. has been the Chief Executive Officer at Biogen Idec Inc., since June 2010. Dr. Scangos served as President and Chief Executive Officer at Exelixis Inc., a holding company of X-ceptor Therapeutics, Inc. from October 1996 to July 2010. He served as the President of Biotechnology of Bayer Corporation from September 1993 to October 1996 and was responsible for 1,100 employees in research and development, business development, process development, ... manufacturing, engineering, and quality assurance. He spent 10 years at Bayer Corporation. He joined Bayer in 1987 as a staff scientist. At Bayer, he served in several positions, including Senior Vice President of Research and Development for Bayer's pharmaceutical division and then President of Bayer Biotechnology. He has nearly 25 years of experience in the biotechnology and pharmaceutical industries. Dr. Scangos served as the Chairman of Anadys Pharmaceuticals Inc. since December 31, 2005. He serves as the Vice Chairman of California Healthcare Institute (CHI). He has been a Director of Exelixis, Inc. since October 1996. He serves as a Director at BayBio. He has been a Director of Biogen Idec Inc. since June 2010. He has been an Independent Director of Anadys Pharmaceuticals Inc. since October 2003. He serves as a Director of The Global Alliance for TB Drug Development. He served as a Director of Symphony Evolution, Inc. Dr. Scangos served as a Non Executive Director of Entelos, Inc. since September 1997. Dr. Scangos served as a Director of Onyx Pharmaceuticals, Inc. from June 2000 to March 2005. He serves as an Adjunct Professor of Biology at Johns Hopkins University. He previously was a Professor of Biology at Johns Hopkins University for six years. He serves as a Director of Foundation Sante. He serves on the Board of Visitors at the University of California, San Francisco School of Pharmacy, the Board of Overseers at the University of California, Davis Medical School. He was a Jane Coffin Childs Postdoctoral Fellow in the laboratory of Frank Ruddle at Yale University. Dr. Scangos holds a B.A. in Biology from Cornell University and a Ph.D. in Microbiology from the University of Massachusetts. manufacturing, engineering, and quality assurance. column5: University of Pennsylvania - The Wharton School
column10: Mr. William C. Cobb, Bill serves as the Chief Executive Officer and President of H&R Block Bank. Mr. Cobb has been the Chief Executive Officer and the President of H&R Block Inc. since May 16, 2011. He served as the President of eBay Marketplaces of North America at eBay Inc. since December 2006. He served as the President of the flagship U.S. Marketplaces division. He served as President of eBay North America of eBay Inc. from December 2004 to December 2006 and as also ... served as its Senior Vice President of Global Marketing from November 2000 to September 2002. He served as Senior Vice President of eBay International, a subsidiary of eBay Inc. from September 2002 to December 2004 and also served as its General Manager since September 2002 and Senior Vice President of Global Marketing, where he was responsible for strategic planning, development, and operations for its businesses and investments around the world. He joined eBay in November 2000 and served there until 2008. Prior to eBay, Mr. Cobb served at PepsiCo. as Vice President of New Business and was responsible for new products, joint ventures and acquisitions for the soft drink division. He served various marketing and executive positions at Pepsico/Tricon for thirteen years. He served a number of key positions at Frito Lay and Pepsi-Cola divisions. From February 2000 to June 2000, he served as General Manager of Consumer Sales of Netpliance, Inc. He served as Senior Vice President of International Marketing of Tricon Global Restaurants, Inc. (now YUM! Brands, Inc.), from July 1997 to February 2000. He served as Senior Vice President and Chief Marketing Officer of Pizza Hut, Inc., a division of Tricon Global Restaurants, Inc. from August 1995 to July 1997. He served as Senior Vice President and Chief Marketing Officer for Tricon Restaurants International, a PepsiCo spin-off, where he Vice President for Colas of Pepsi-Cola Co., a division of PepsiCo., Inc. from May 1994 to August 1995. He served as an International Chief Marketing Officer of Tricon. Mr. Cobb served as Vice President of Pepsi Brands. He has been a Director at H&R Block, Inc. since August 2010. He serves as a Director of the non-profit Bay Harbor Foundation. He serves on the Advisory Board of the Kellogg School of Management at Northwestern University. He served as a Director of Och-Ziff Capital Management Group LLC from September 2008 to June 23, 2011; Pacific Sunwear of California Inc. from August 2008 to June 1, 2011 and Orbitz Worldwide Inc. from July 2008 to March 25, 2011. He served as a Member of the Board of Industry Leaders of Consumer Electronics Association. His accomplishments include the launch of All Sport Body Quencher, Aquafina Water, and the Pepsi/Starbucks Coffee partnership for ready-to-drink coffee products. Mr. Cobb holds a Bachelors of Science in Economics from the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania and a Masters of Business Administration from the Kellogg School of Management at Northwestern University. served as its Senior Vice President of Global Marketing from November 2000 to September 2002. column3: Executive Chairman, Chief Executive Officer, Chairman of Special Programs Committee and Member of Stock Plan Committee,
column10: Mr. W. James McNerney, also known as Jim, Jr. has been the Chief Executive Officer and Executive Chairman at The Boeing Company at Boeing Commercial Airplanes, Inc. since July 1, 2005. Mr. McNerney served as President at The Boeing Company. Before taking the helm at Boeing on July 1, 2005, he served as the Chief Executive Officer of 3M Company from January 1, 2001 to June 2005, and served as its Chairman from 2001 to June 2005. He served as the Chief Executive Officer ... and Chairman of 3M Cardiovascular Devices, Inc. He joined 3M in 2000 after 19 years at the General Electric Company. He joined General Electric in 1982. He served in management positions at General Electric Company, including the Chief Executive Officer and the President of GE Aircraft Engines from 1997 to 2000. At General Electric, he served as the Chief Executive Officer and the President of GE Lighting, Cleveland, OH from 1995 to 1997; President of GE Asia-Pacific, Hong Kong from 1993 to 1995, the Chief Executive Officer and the President of GE Electrical Distribution & Control, Plainville, CT from 1991 to 1992, Executive Vice President of GE Financial Services and GE Capital, Stamford, CT from 1989 to 1991, the President of GE Information Services of Rockville, Managing Director from 1988 to 1989 and as General Manager of GE Mobile Communications from 1982 to 1988. He first worked at Procter & Gamble in brand management and as a Senior Manager of McKinsey & Co., Inc. He serves as Chairman of Boeing Commercial Airplanes, Inc. He served as the Chairman of The Business Roundtable since September 1, 2011. He served as the Chairman of US-China Business Council, Inc. and The Business Council. He serves as a Director of The Business Roundtable. He has been an Executive Director of Boeing Co. since 2001. He has been a Presiding Director of Procter & Gamble Co. since August 14, 2007 and has been its Director since May 1, 2003. column3: Chief Executive Officer, President and Director,
column10: Mr. Michael F. Mahoney, also known as Mike has been the Chief Executive Officer of Boston Scientific Corporation since November 1, 2012 and as its President since October 17, 2011. At Boston Scientific Corporation, Mr. Mahoney is responsible for Boston Scientific's Cardiac Rhythm Management (CRM) and Endoscopy (GI and Pulmonary) businesses, as well as certain corporate functions. He joined Boston Scientific in October 2011, having established a track record of more than ... 22 years of healthcare experience in building market leading global businesses in medical devices, capital equipment, and healthcare IT service businesses at best-in-class companies. Prior to joining Boston Scientific, he served as Worldwide Chairman of Medical Device and Diagnostics Group (MD&D) at Johnson & Johnson since January 3, 2011. He served as a Group Chairman, DePuy Franchise of Johnson & Johnson until January 3, 2011. In this role, he successfully drove a growth strategy via product innovation, multiple acquisitions, and International expansion, particularly in China and India. Prior to joining Johnson & Johnson, Mr. Mahoney served as the President and Chief Executive Officer of Global Healthcare Exchange (GHX). He built Global Healthcare Exchange through organic development and strategic acquisitions, successfully integrating seven acquisitions and expanding the business into Europe and Canada. He built his early career at General Electric Medical Systems, where he spent 12 years, in a variety of advancing leadership roles for domestic and global businesses in CT, MRI, X-ray, Healthcare IT, and Nuclear Medicine, culminating in the role of General Manager of the Healthcare Information Technology business. He serves as a Director of Boston Scientific Corporation. Mr. Mahoney earned a B.B.A. in Finance from the University of Iowa and a M.B.A. from Wake Forest University. 22 years of healthcare experience in building market leading global businesses in medical devices, capital equipment, and healthcare IT service businesses at best-in-class companies. He built his early career at General Electric Medical Systems, where he spent 12 years, in a variety of advancing leadership roles for domestic and global businesses in CT, MRI, X-ray, Healthcare IT, and Nuclear Medicine, culminating in the role of General Manager of the Healthcare Information Technology business. He serves as a Director of Boston Scientific Corporation. Mr. Mahoney earned a B.B.A. in Finance from the University of Iowa and a M.B.A. from Wake Forest University.

column3: Executive Chairman,
column10: Mr. James L. Dolan has been the Chief Executive Officer of CSC Holdings, LLC since October 1995 and President since June 1998. Mr. Dolan serves as the Chairman, Chief Executive Officer and President of New York Knicks. He has been the Chief Executive Officer of Cablevision Systems Corporation since October 1995 and as its President since June 1998. He oversees its telecommunications and entertainment businesses, including its cable television offerings, high-speed broadband ... Internet access, national television program networks and Clearview Cinemas. He oversees the management of the many Garden entities, which include the Garden facilities, its professional teams - the Knicks, Rangers and Liberty - the MSG Network, and Radio City Music Hall. Prior to assuming his present post at Cablevision, Mr. Dolan amassed more than two decades of experience in the management of cable systems, telecommunications programming and advertising. He served as the Vice President of Cablevision Systems Corp. from 1987 to September 1992. Mr. Dolan served as Chief Executive Officer of Rainbow Programming Holdings, Inc. (now Rainbow Media Holdings, Inc.), a subsidiary of Cablevision, where he built his reputation as a leader in the development of Rainbow's niche programming networks from September 1992 to October 1995. At Rainbow, he oversaw all facets of the business, which today operates multiple entertainment, news and sports networks, reaching millions of households in the United States and abroad. He served as Vice President of CSC Holdings from 1987 to September 1992. Mr. Dolan began his career with Cablevision in the 1970s in the Plainview, New York cable system. Throughout the 1980s, he managed its radio properties and its pioneering cable advertising sales organization before moving on to Rainbow Programming. He has been the Executive Chairman of Madison Square Garden, Inc( The Madison Square Garden Company). since July 29, 2009 and has been the Chairman of Madison Square Garden, L.P. since 1991. He served as the Chairman of Cablevision Systems Corporation since October 2003. He has been a Director of National Cable Satellite Corporation since 2012, Cablevision Systems Corporation since 1991; CSC Holdings Inc., since 1991 and AMC Networks Inc. since March 9, 2011. He serves as a Director of Madison Square Garden of Cablevision Systems Corp. column10: Ms. Denise M. Morrison has been the Chief Executive Officer and President of Campbell Soup Company since August 1, 2011. (alternate name: Kraft Foods Inc.), from October 2001 to March 2003, where she was responsible for such leading brands as Planters nuts, Lifesavers and Altoids. column10: Mr. Robert Douglas Lawler, also known as Doug, has been the Chief Executive Officer and President of Chesapeake Energy Corporation since June 17, 2013. Mr. Lawler served as Vice President of Operations at Anadarko Petroleum Corporation from December 2011 to July 2012 and was responsible for overseeing its operations and development activities throughout its Southern Region, which includes Kansas, Oklahoma, Louisiana, Pennsylvania and Texas. He was employed for 25 years by Anadarko Petroleum Corporation and Kerr-McGee Corporation, where he served in multiple engineering and leadership positions within a diverse geographic portfolio including U.S. onshore, deepwater Gulf of Mexico and international assets.
